title: 2 Easy Ways to Open the Task Manager on Chromebook

steps.title: On your keyboard, press Search+Esc at the same time.
steps.content: On your keyboard, press Search + Esc at the same time. The Search key is located on the left side of the keyboard, usually in the place of Caps Lock. It will have a magnifying glass icon. The Esc key will be at the top-left corner. You can use the Task Manager to close applications, similar to force quitting apps on Mac or on Windows . [1] X Research source

steps.title: View the Task Manager.
steps.content: View the Task Manager. After pressing the keys, the Chrome OS Task Manager will open. It will resemble the Mac and Windows Task Manager .

steps.title: Right-click the taskbar.
steps.content: Right-click the taskbar. This is the menu along the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Click Task Manager.
steps.content: Click Task Manager . The Task Manager window will open. You can now use it to close a frozen program or check your memory usage .
